summary: The project manager opened the meeting and had the team members introduce themselves by name and their role in the project. The project manager introduced the upcoming project to the team and then had the team members participate in a tool training exercise in which each member drew his favorite animal on the white board and discussed what he liked about the animal. The project manager also discussed selling prices and the project budget. The team then discussed their experiences with remotes, focusing on various features they would like to see in the remote they will produce, as well as features they find unappealing in current remotes.
actions: The interface designer will work on the technical functions of the remote. The marketing expert will find the user requirements for the remote
decisions: The remote will sell for 25 Euro. The remote will be sold internationally. The production costs cannot exceed 12.50 Euro.

"I like horses because they are beautiful and strong
-> line favorite animal bird"

The image includes drawings of a horse, a cat's face, and a bird.

1: PARIS, August 31, 2004 - Real Reaction © Electronics Europe introduced a 7" TFT screen that meets the needs of educational and corporate customers who want a transportable, lightweight design, along with the flexibility to make presentations in rooms with challenging lighting conditions and limited space.

0: Presented by: Hamed Ketabdar, User Interface Designer
1: Design a user interface for remote control, easy to use, no need for learning speecial functions
2:
It is better to put most frequently buttons in the middle of the remote control, they should be also bigger
The shape of the remote control should be in a way which is comfortable in hand. Rounded shape corners …
Not very eneregy consuming
3:
The less frequently used buttons should be hided by a cover.
Some buttons, like volume change can be placed in side of the remote.  
Usage of an speech recognizer

0: Presented by: Hamed Ketabdar,  User Interface Designer
1:
A remote control is an electronic device sending commands by waves (Infrared, radio) to another device.
It consists of different blocks:
	The interface with buttons
	The electronic circuit making commands
	The transmitter
2:
Usually there are two different methods for designing a remote control
	- Remote control based on Infrared waves
	- Remote control based on Radio waves
People prefer to have remote controls with bigger buttons
3:
A remote control with based on radio waves
Using bigger buttons and less number of buttons

0:
Presented by: Bob Morris,
 Marketing Expert
1:
List the various design criteria
Rate how well the proposed design matches each of the criteria
1 to 7 point scale, 1=v.true, 7=v.false
2:
Criteria
The remote control is not ugly
The remote control looks fancy
The remote control is easy to find when it gets lost
The remote control is easy to learn how to use
The remote control does not cause RSI
The remote control is technologically innovative
The remote control is easy to use
The remote control follows a fruit and vegetables theme
The remote control has a spongy feel
The remote control uses company colours
3:
Criteria rating with seven-point scale
Final result = average of scores for each of the criteria.
…

0:
Presented by: Bob Morris,
 Market Expert
1:
Useability study in laboratory with 100 test subjects.
Each participant also completed a questionaire.
2:
Users are do not like look-and-feel of most remotes
75% of users find most remote controls ugly 
Current remote controls do not match well the operating behavior of the user 
50% of users say they only use 10% of the buttons 

Usage statistics
Channel button used on average 168 times/hour
Teletext 14 times / hour
Volume 4 times/hour
Channel, volume, power had highest relevance to users
Audio and picture settings had least relevance
3:
The biggest frustrations users expressed

Remote controls are often lost somewhere in the room (50%) 
It takes too much time to learn how to use a new remote control (34%) 
Remote controls are bad for RSI (26%)
4:
LCD display ?
Speech recognition ?

Younger age groups yes (91% yes 15-25)
Older users no (60% 55-65)

0:
Presented by: 
Bob ‘the marketing expert’ Morris
1:
Remote control market research
Interviews with Paris/Milan based fashion watchers
2:
‘fancy’ look-and-feel is HIGHEST PRIORITY
‘functional’ no longer important
Technological innovation is 2nd Priority
2x less important as fanciness
Easy-to-use is 3rd priority
2x less important as technological innovation
3:
This year, fruit & vegetables will be the most important theme for cloths, shoes, and furniture.
Also in contrast to last year, the feel of material is expected to be spongy.
4:
Remote control that is ....
Fancy
Technologically innovative
Related to fruit/vegetables with a spongy feel
Easy to use
From last meeting ... Use company colours

doc.content:
Report



Meeting 1 :



Introduction of the participants :

Marketing Expert (ME): Bob

Project Manager (PM): Fabien

User Interface Manager (UIM): Hamed

Industrial Manager(IM): Petr



This meeting was the first of the project. It was a short presentation of the goal of the project. The participants had to use the new tools (eg. white boards) . We also exposed our first ideas and knowledge about remote control





Meeting 2:



In this meeting there were 3 presentation from the Bob, Hamed and Petr. 

Bob presented the user requirements based on a study over 100 test subjects

Hamed presented technical aspect of remote control 

Petr talked about available devices such as LCD or speech recognition features.

Then, Fabien presented the last requirement from the management board:

No teletex

Only for TV

Corporate image should stay recognizable in the product



	We made the decision to use slider buttons for the volume setting.

	We also decided to use LCD screen in order to minimize the number of buttons.

	The setting buttons will be hidden somewhere, so that they will disturb the user for the usual remote control usage. 

	

Meeting 3:



Bob presented the needs of the users:

Fancy more important than functional. Technical inovation more important than functional but less than fancy

The fancy tendancy are Fruits and Vegetables and spongy material this year.

 

 

Hamed thinks it is important to have a device easy to use and that the user do not need to learn how to use it

He says it is possible to have a speech recognizer if it is in sleep mode when there is no sound

 

Petr posposed a 7'' TFT device  and Infra-Red technology.

Automatic Speech Recognision could be used if we use solar cells in addition with batteries.

 

	 We decided:

	-To use a 5x10 LCD

	- to banana shape where we could open the 1st layer (the skin of the banana) to find the setting buttons.

	- We will use infra-red

	- The first layer will be soft, magnets will close it

	- We will use speech recognition

	 



Meeting 4:





That was the final meeting

We have discussed about the prototype

We fitted the product in the budget by removing the LCD and the wheel button

We did an evaluation of the project

The final budget for the remote control is: 12.2 Euro

- edited by Participant 2 – Petr –



Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.



The main goal of the 2nd meeting was to bring the insight to the remote control development from the point of view of industrial designer, user-interface designer, and marketing expert, respectively. Manager added his own remarks. Decision was taken on the overall ideas such as what electrical components to use what controls to use on the device, what properties the device should have as a whole.

 

  

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	use infrared communication (no radio waves)

	use display on the unit

	hierarchial menu structure

	teletext obsolete – not use it

	keep the power button

	roller button for menus
 

	  

	  

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	role of speech recognition in the unit

	

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



make a presentation on recent facts and ideas

write a report

check mails, answer questionnaires

- edited by Petr -



Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 On the 3rd meeting, all participants presented their concrete ideas, visions, and requirements to the device and a discussion brought the decision on all the properties of the prototype.

 

 

  

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

- fancy and spongy look – *banana shape*

	big buttons close to the banana center 

	small screen

	speech recognition supported – solar cells requirement + batteries

	size to fit with display fixed to 5 times 10 centimeters

	peeling-off the fruit will recover the hidden buttons

	 

	  

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	available display too big – needs to be cut

	material of peeling problematic

	 

	 

	  

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



user interface designer and industrial designer will make a prototype

- marketing expert will do an evaluation

Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

The objective of the last meeting was to present and evaluate the prototype of a remote control unit. At the beginning, both developers (industrial designer and user-interface designer) introduced their prototype to other meeting members and answered all technical questions. After the presentation, project manager evaluated the costs of the unit and a final decision on materials and parts was taken. Finally, marketing expert did the overall evaluation of the project, which included the rating of meeting the specific goals and the project manager opened a celebration of the project success.

  

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	- not to use display in the unit

	- avoid solar cell

	- replace the wheel button by common knobs

	

	 [PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

- the *financial resources were very limited* 

	almost no money for the prototype (developers had to buy some material themselves!)

	need to redesign the circuit board based on decision taken

	 

	  

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



hopefully nothing or

wait for another AMI meeting recording

- edited by Participant 2 – Petr –



Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 Initial meeting. It gave us very preliminary insight of our roles in the project. The task is to design a new remote control for TV set. There are four responsible participants in the project, which were speaking. Project manager made a brief introduction and all participants presented their first ideas related to the project requirements. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

- use only a small number of buttons for the device

	use radio waves instead of IR for communication with TV

	backlight the buttons of the device 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

- earphones/microphones attached to us have short wires, not long enough to go to board!

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

I don’t have specific idea of others, but I guess all participants should prepare a presentation of their point of view

[ABSTRACT]   



The meeting was about general goals off the project, knowing different persons taking part in the project and their opinions. We have also practiced usage of the meeting instruments.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]  

	
To read the instructions about the project and prepare for the next meeting.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	
some people didn’t know how to use headsets

	* There was a difficulty to pass the headset cable when I tried to go and write something on the white board.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  



All persons should read the instructions about the project and prepare for the next meeting.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 

 Different aspects of designing a remote control from user interface to technical details was presented.

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	-Not include teletext in the remote control

	-The remote control should be designed only for TV and not for DVD and other devices

	*- The color and trade mark of the company should appear some how in the remote control shape and color
*- Volume and Channel change buttons should be designed in a way which is easy to use for the client. It is better not to have lots of buttons on the remote control. Sliding or rolling buttons should be used for the channel and volume buttons. 

	*- Setting buttons and buttons related to complex functions should be hided by a cover or should be placed at the back side of the remote control 

	 

	 

	  

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	- We should yet think about the usage of infrared or radio waves, A clear decision was not made yet.

	*- We should yet decide about the usage of speech recognizer, the decision was not made yet.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Prepare for the next presentation

Thinking about usage of either infra red or  radio waves, about LCD display and also including speech recognizer in the system.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 Some different and detailed aspects of design where discussed. Some final decision was made about the shape, color and electronic design details was made.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	It should have fancy look and feel. 

	Energy supply: Battery and Solar cell

	 Approximate size: 5x10

	Color and shape: like a yellow banana

	The LCD and extra buttons with less frequent usage are inside the banana, they will appear like peeling a banana

	Speech recognition system should also be included

	 

	  

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	Not enough time to think about some issues

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Making a prototype for the remote control

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

A design process was discussed in the meeting. We started from preliminary discussions about different design factors. We continued with some more detailed discussion on different issues. We made final decisions about different aspects of the design. Finally a template was made based on our discussion showing how final product would appear. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	- Decisions about the overall design process

	*- Decisions about the Shape (Banana shape, yellow color, having the color and trade mark of the company)

	*- Decisions about user interface ( Placing the buttons with more frequent usage at the right place and making them in the bigger size, Hiding other buttons inside a remote control)

	- Decisions about Technical issues (Usage of LCD, Usage of solar cells and batteries, having speech recognition system)

	- Some decisions about removing some features to decrease the price.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 - Some problems for reaching the white board having with the headset.

	 - Sometimes there was not enough time to finish some reports and make presentations.

	 - The price issue was not considered and discussed enough during the design process. We discussed about price issues at the end and we had to remove some features which we spent a lot of time to decide about them before.

	 

	  

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

[ABSTRACT]   



The meeting was about general goals off the project, knowing different persons taking part in the project and their opinions. We have also practiced usage of the meeting instruments.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]  

	
To read the instructions about the project and prepare for the next meeting.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	
some people didn’t know how to use headsets

	* There was a difficulty to pass the headset cable when I tried to go and write something on the white board.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  



All persons should read the instructions about the project and prepare for the next meeting.
